string-array.item: AISD
RRISD

string-array.name: quotes_array
string-array.item:
"Study: The act of texting, eating, and watching TV with an open textbook nearby."
 -the"
 -mind"
 -of"
 -mia"
 -moreno
\"Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.\"\n -Albert Einstein
\"Those who don\'t know history are doomed to repeat it.\"\n -Edmund Burke
\"The authority of those who teach is often an obstacle to those who want to learn.\"\n -Cicero
\"Instruction does much, but encouragement everything.\"\n -Goethe
\"Teaching is not a lost art, but the regard for it is a lost tradition.\"\n -Jacques Barzun
\"Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited; imagination encircles the world.\"\n -Albert Einstein
\"The difference between school and life? In school, you\'re taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you\'re given a test that teaches you a lesson.\"\n -Tom Bodett
\"Public education was not founded to give society what it wants. Quite the opposite.\"\n -May Sarton
\"School prepares you for the real world... which also bites.\"\n -Jim Benton
\"School made us \'literate\' but did not teach us to read for pleasure.\"\n -Ambeth R. Ocampo
\"A teacher is one who makes himself progresively unnecessary.\"\n -Thomas Carruthers
\"You will ever remember that all the end of study is to make you a good man and a useful citizen.\"\n -John Adams
\"You can\'t eat straight A\'s.\"\n -Maxine Hong Kingston
\"The philosophy of the schoolroom in one generation is the philosophy of government in the next.\"\n -Abraham Lincoln
\"As you can see, there are quite a number of things taught in school that one has to unlearn or at least correct.\"\n -Ambeth R. Ocampo
\"There\'s always a bit of suspense about the particular way in which a given school year will get off to a bad start.\"\n -Frank Portman
\"There\'s no crying in the rank book.\"\n -William Morton
\"It\'s much easier on the emotions when one sees life as an experiment rather than a struggle for popularity.\"\n -Criss Jami
\"thnkz 4 hlpng e wth e spllng d gwammer mestr josef\"\n -Ward Schiller
\"Don\'t ask what your school can do for you, ask what you can do for your school.\"\n -Josh Zigal
\"A good education helps us make sense of the world and find our way in it.\"\n -Mike Rose
\"A witty quote proves nothing.\"\n -Voltaire
\"By doing nothing, you become nothing.\"\n -unknown
\"Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.\"\n -Lao Tzu
\"I want to put a ding in the universe.\"\n -Steve Jobs
\"Sometimes life hits you in the head with a brick. Don\'t lose faith.\"\n -Steve Jobs
\"If tomorrow ain\'t the due date, today ain\'t the do date.\"\n -Freya
\"Knowledge is having the right answer. Intelligence is asking the right question.\"\n -unknown
\"Many of life\'s failures are people who didn\'t realize how close they were to success when they gave up.\"\n -Thomas Edison
\"A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.\"\n -Ayn Rand
\"Be so good they can\'t ignore you.\"\n -Steve Martin
\"Hard work beats talent when talent doesn\'t work hard.\"\n -Tim Notke
\"Your future is created by what you do today, not tomorrow.\"\n -Robert Kiyosaki
\"Before I do anything, I ask myself, \"Would an idiot do that?\" and if the answer is yes, I do not do that thing.\"\n -Dwight Schrute
\"Work hard. Dream big.\"\n -unknown
\"Try not to become a man of success but rather a man of value.\"\n -Albert Einstein
\"The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, or knowledge, but rather a lack in will.\"\n -Vince Lombardi
\"If you\'re going through hell, keep going.\"\n -Winston Churchill

\"If you always put a limit on everything you do, it will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.\"\n -Bruce Lee
\"Don\'t fear failure... in great attempts it is glorious even to fail.\"\n -Bruce Lee
\"Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.\"\n -Nikola Tesla
\"I could either watch it happen, or be part of it.\"\n -Elon Musk
